title: SAKTHI
detailsOfAchievement: The motto of Sakthi is to work with the socially excluded communities especially women and children. Vidiyal a programme of Sakthi was initiated in 1996. Though Sakthi is the registered legal entity Vidiyal has gained the patronage from the general public earned goodwill and popularity. Today we use Sakthi and Vidiyal inter changeably or sometimes together like Sakthi Vidiyal to ensure a clear understanding of the nature of relationship. Sakthi Vidiyal has established and runs seven Child Resource Centres in Madurai. Vidiyal programme addresses the need to build a concept of Self rebuilding identities milestone transitions provides space and scope to explore self and self in relation to others and activities to develop their potential. The success of Vidiyal programme lay in its multi dimensional approach. Community Mentorship programme enables partnership with the slum communities and ensures protection to the children living in these communities. A Child Policy has been developed through a participatory process covers the entire child rights domain and governs any intervention concerning children. Children participate in the working of the organization with representation in the board and committees working for the welfare of the child. Development of personhood in children is encouraged and recognized with due respect. In 2000 Sakthi Vidiyal initiated the Vidiyal Child Rights Movement a child led organization. The children home of Sakthi Vidiyal is recognized by Government of Tamilnadu as the Reception Home under the Juvenile Justice Care and Protection Act 2015 for run away and abandoned children through judicial custody. Sakthi Vidiyal stands in lieu as the children guardians. We served as a member in the District Level Advisory Committee constituted for the prevention of trafficking in women and children. Sakthi Vidiyal is the collaborative organization for running Madurai Childline project of the central ministry of Women and Child Development. Sakthi Vidiyal advocates for the entire Child Rights agenda and actively participating in networks for advocacy and policy change. Sakthi Vidiyal is a founding member of the National Movement of Working Children in India through which working children are represented in the United Nations Committee on Convention on the Rights of the Child. The Child Rights for World Social Forum is a national level network of organizations working for the promotion of Child Rights aims at mainstreaming children agenda in a globalizing world through child participation. Sakthi Vidiyal is the state secretariat for the Campaign Against Child Trafficking Tamilnadu. Sakthi Vidiyal played a proactive role in the formation of the Forum for the Promotion of Child Participation Tamilnadu and Pudhucherry. Sakthi Vidiyal also networks with the schools in Madurai and advocates for promoting safe environment in schools. The Snakes and Ladders one of the child rights promotion games is designed by Sakthi Vidiyal translated into six languages is used as a child friendly tool in educating children about their Rights. Sakthi Vidiyal is founding member of the Child Rights Observatory in Tamilnadu supported by UNICEF.

AFTER THE TRAININGS THE VICTIMS ARE PLACED IN JOBS AND EARN DECENT INCOME.

title: Sharana Breast Cancer Relief and Research Foundation
detailsOfAchievement: Sharana focuses on patients who are affected by breast cancer and cannot afford their medication. It provides direct services to people battling breast cancer through direct assistance, enlisting other charitable trusts for financial aid and compassionate support. The cost of treatment for breast cancer which includes surgery, radio therapy and chemo therapy is likely to be around 2 to 3 lakhs. Through Sharana Dr. Selvi Radhakrishna has helped 54 patients with diagnostic service, surgical service, hospitalization expenses, chemotherapy drug procurement and radio therapy. In addition to diagnostic and treatment service Sharana also created awareness and performs screening for different groups of women across Chennai.

detailsOfAchievement: Ours is a registered society catering to the needs of orphans, destitute children, widows and deserted women and above all the aged. We work in rural and urban areas of Chennai, Kancheepuram and Tiruvellore District. Share and Care is dedicated to eliminate the suffering of the poor through education and poverty through variety of social welfare programme and outreach activities. Our first programme in 1984 started with helping the pregnant mothers with good nutrition and care of the new born babies. in 1989 we built 150 toilets, planted trees and also installed pipes in the fishermen village near Mahabalipuram. In 1988 we opened a health centre for polioin Chennai and later we have a rehabilitation home for physically challenged girls who are learning skills to meet their livelihood. We had four creches in the city as well as in the rural areas covering 30 children. At present we have one creche in the rural areas. We started with 50 children. At present we have 200 children in the home where we give them the basic facilities like shelter, food and clothes. We have a primary school and High School. 500 children are imparted education. The High School was started in 1990. It was especially started for Scheduled Caste and Tribal communities. We bring these children into main stram of curriculum from the remote villages providing free transport, clothing, text books, excursion, yearly games, mid day meals, inter school games and yoga. Our school secures 98% every year in the State Board Examination. Health Centre in Katchur benefits community in large. Age care was started in 1985. Today we are having 400 older persons covering in the 4 day centres in Tiruvellore District and 2 distribution centre in Chennai. We have been repairing the huts of elders now and then. We also started Revolving Fund Scheme for 150 elder persons. 20 medical camp, 12 eye camps we have covered in the past years. 450 cataract surgeries have been done. 900 spectacles supplied to the elders. We have arranged to get the old age pension for more than 200 older persons. We also distribute provisions, toileteries, detergent, pocket money to the centres in Katchur as well as Manali in Chennai. In the Day Centre we give 3 times food, clothes, pocket money, recreation. Income generation programme was also started by giving them buffalos in the Revolving Fund Scheme. We give awareness programme to the elders on variety of subjects. We conduct advocacy programme for the elders and women. We impart education to the women and empower them by micro credit fund. Training is imparted to them on variety of programmes like catering, enterprenurship, budgeting, banking, etc. We have 500 women groups in the different villages in Tiruvellore District. We have non formal centre on the way to Mahabalipuram in Kancheepuram District. 50 children attend the evening tuition centre. Achievements: share and care children welfare society is taking care of under previledged children both boys and girls widows and woman in the stress and the aged in need since 1984. the activities are spread over in slums in chennai, fisherman villages in kanchipuram dist and rural villages in thiruvalur dist in tamilnadu. we run home for destitute and orphan boys and girls since 1984 primary and high schools for the upliftment of poor children especially belong to dalith and tribal communities since 1991 in katchur dist. we formed 350 woman self-help group and help them in starting small rates, youth groups and group for elders. 250 polio affected girls where given pre surgical corrections physiotheraphy and artificial limbs, wheelchairs and given training in income generation programs. Age care programs through our day care centres in the villages and giving them food and recreational activities. periodical medical dental and eye camps conducted. built toitets for fisherman villages and huts for poor and eletrification of huts in katchur village. we helped people affected by natural calamities.
